newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late palm olein unchanged, trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late palm olein unchanged, trade thin.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were unchanged in late trading on Monday as market sentiment improved ahead of the Eid al-Fitr celebration and rises in Malaysia, traders said.

They said palm olein was unchanged at 1,445-50 rupiah/kg in Jakarta but offers were also heard at 1,440 rupiah in Java. Crude palm oil was done on Saturday at an equivalent 1,270 rupiah/kg at a 1,000-tonne tender in Medan. CPO was last done at 1,259 in Medan at a 1,000-tonne tender on Thursday.
"Market sentiment is starting to improve because demand usually picks up ahead of the Eid al-Fitr," said one trader.

The Eid al-Fitr celebration, which marks the end of the Ramadan fasting month, will be on February 9 and 10. Traders said demand was expected to improve because people would start buying cooking oil for the celebration.
Cargo surveyor Societe Generale de Surveillance (SGS) Malaysia Sdn Bhd said last week it estimated Malaysia's palm oil exports for January at 586,046 tonnes against 717,197 in December.
Traders in Medan said tight local supply also boosted prices in addition to the Malaysian factor.
